episodes.title: 3 million pages of Epstein documents released
episodes.description:
The Department of Justice released 3 million pages of Epstein documents, along with 2,000 videos and 180,000 photos. The release included emails between Elon Musk and Epstein, coordinating a possible visit to the billionaire’s infamous island. It’s unclear if he actually visited and Musk has previously said he denied Epstein’s invitations to visit. NBC News’ Ryan Nobles reports.
  
For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: Blanche acknowledges Epstein victims' frustrations, denies protecting Trump
episodes.description:
Responding to a question from reporters about victims who have expressed frustration with the Justice Department's process for releasing Epstein files, Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche said, "Same here." He also insisted there was no effort to protect President Trump.

episodes.title: House panel votes to hold Clintons in contempt for failing to testify in Epstein investigation
episodes.description:
The House Oversight Committee voted to recommend holding former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress for failing to testify in the committee’s Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

episodes.title: DOJ scrambling to review more than 5 million Epstein documents
episodes.description:
The Justice Department is scrambling to review roughly 5.2 million documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, according to a source familiar with the operation. That number is much higher than previously known. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez reports.

For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: New documents in the Jeffrey Epstein Case
episodes.description: The Justice Department today said federal prosecutors and the FBI have uncovered more than a million new documents related to the Epstein investigation. NBC News White House Correspondent Julie Tsirkin reports.

episodes.title: DOJ says it has uncovered over one million more Epstein-related files
episodes.description:
The Justice Department said it had uncovered over one million more files potentially related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The DOJ said it "may take a few more weeks" to review the files produced by the FBI and the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York.

For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: DOJ faces criticism over Epstein files release
episodes.description:
Some Epstein survivors said the DOJ has redacted too much information in the Epstein files that were released to the public. The DOJ said that its redactions include information about victims. NBC News’ Ryan Nobles reports.

For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: Lawmakers demand answers from Justice Dept. after Epstein files release
episodes.description: Reps. Ro Khanna, D-Calif., and Thomas Massie, R-Ky., on Sunday said they are committed to holding Justice Department officials accountable for their failure to release all eligible Epstein files by Friday’s deadline, saying they're speaking with members of Congress about holding Attorney General Pam Bondi in contempt. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin reports.

episodes.title: Survivors and families speak out after release of Epstein files
episodes.description: Some survivors of the abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, and the survivors’ families, are speaking out after the Justice Department released the Epstein files. NBC News’ Hallie Jackson spoke with Sky Roberts, brother of Virginia Roberts Giuffre, along with Annie Farmer, to hear their reaction to how the release was handled.

episodes.title: Deputy AG Blanche says DOJ ‘not redacting information’ on Trump in Epstein files: Full interview
episodes.description: In an exclusive interview with Meet the Press, Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche defends the Justice Department’s release of thousands of records related to Jeffrey Epstein amid criticism over the department’s partial release and redactions.

episodes.title: Tim Kaine says Bill Clinton ‘should address’ photos in Epstein files: Full interview
episodes.description: In an exclusive interview with Meet the Press, Sen. Tim Kaine (D-Va.) reacts to the partial release of the Epstein files, which included multiple photos of former President Bill Clinton, and criticizes the Trump administration’s military advances in Venezuela.

episodes.title: Dec. 20: Epstein files removed
episodes.description: Some Epstein documents released by the Justice Department no longer available

episodes.title: 'Now the world can see': Epstein survivor describes feeling validated as files are released
episodes.description:
Dani Bensky, a survivor of Jeffrey Epstein, joins News Now to weigh in on the recently released documents from the Justice Department and what she hopes happens from here.

For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: 'You're a terrible person': Trump slams ABC News reporter after Epstein question
episodes.description:
President Donald Trump reacted strongly after ABC News reporter Mary Bruce asked him about files related to Jeffrey Epstein. Trump told Bruce that she was "a terrible person and a terrible reporter" and floated the idea of revoking the company's broadcast license.

episodes.title: How Assemblies of God churches allegedly shielded predators as they abused children
episodes.description:
NBC News identified nearly 200 Assemblies of God pastors, church employees and volunteer leaders who were accused of allegedly sexually abusing over 475 people, mostly children, over the past 50 years. Victims are now speaking out and looking for change from top leadership after those accused of sexual misconduct were reinstated in the past.

For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: Justice Department responds to hidden camera video of official talking Epstein files plan
episodes.description:
The Department of Justice is pushing back on statements made by a senior department official in a hidden camera video obtained by the far-right group Project Veritas. The man says in the video that all Republican names in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation files will be redacted. NBC News' Gary Grumbach details the department's response so far.

episodes.title: Epstein survivor speaks out about plans to release unofficial client list
episodes.description:
A victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell speaks out about plans by abuse survivors to release an unofficial client list, after they denounced the Department of Justice's lack of action in the case. Annie Farmer tells NBC News' Tom Llamas about how she first suffered abuse at the age of 16 and how she and fellow survivors will continue to fight for justice.

episodes.title: Family of Virginia Giuffre urges Trump not to pardon Ghislaine Maxwell
episodes.description:
The family of Virginia Giuffre, one of Jeffrey Epstein’s most prominent accusers who died by suicide in April, is urging President Trump not to pardon Ghislaine Maxwell, calling her a “monster.” In an emotional interview, they said granting leniency would silence survivors and undo the work their sister and others fought for.

episodes.title: The Children’s Pastor: The 40-year mission to stop a preacher accused of raping children
episodes.description:
NBC News follows a group of women who allege they were sexually abused by their former pastor as children. Now, decades later, they’ve reunited and found the courage to speak out, determined to stop the alleged predator from harming others.

episodes.title: Lori Vallow on trial for fourth husband's murder
episodes.description:
Another trial is underway for convicted murderer Lori Vallow Daybell, who is already serving life in prison over the killing of her two kids and her fifth husband's previous wife in Idaho. She is back in court over the death of her fourth husband. NBC News' Morgan Chesky is following the trial as Lori Vallow Daybell now represents herself.  For more context and news coverage of the most important stories of our day, click here: https://www.nbcnews.com

episodes.title: Dateline’s Keith Morrison one-one-one with convicted murderer Lori Vallow Daybell
episodes.description:

episodes.title: 'I've been quiet long enough': Woman accusing Jay-Z of sexual assault speaks out
episodes.description:
The woman who is accusing Jay-Z and Sean "Diddy" Combs of sexually assaulting her sat down with NBC News' Chloe Melas in an exclusive interview to talk about her lawsuit. She and her lawyers also acknowledge that there were some inconsistencies in her account in response to questions from NBC News.

episodes.title: Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones (1980) NBC News Review
Kenyan pastor accused of cult that lures hundreds to their death
episodes.description:
Dozens of accused doomsday cult members in Kenya are facing charges of murder and child torture for luring people to their death for the promise of eternal life. The charges are the start of a legal process centered around the cult's leader who is a self-described pastor.

episodes.title: Jonestown Massacre - Port Kaituma Airstrip Shooting
episodes.description: Port Kaituma, GuyanaNovember 18, 1978While the infamous mass suicide is taking place in the remote settlement of Jonestown, seven miles away at Port Kaituma airstrip, Leo Ryan, a U.S Congressman from California, and others are gunned down by members of the Temple's Red Brigade Security Squad. This recording, which happened to capture the first few seconds of the attack, was taken by NBC cameraman Bob Brown, who was among the five people who lost their lives at Port Kaituma airstrip that day, in addition to the 900+ people who died at Jonestown.

episodes.title: NXIVM Sex Cult Leader Keith Raniere Found Guilty On All Charges | NBC News Now
episodes.description:
Keith Raniere, sex cult co-founder of a sex cult known as NXIVM (pronounced "nexium") was found guilty of multiple charges including sex trafficking, conspiracy, racketeering, and possession of child pornography. NBC’s Tom Winter breaks down the details in the case.
